messages.message:
This is very meta....

A partner asked me for pricing on processing 600 pages of very complex, unstructured content per month. The actual page count is closer to 9000 pages per month, with data only on about 10 pages of the 60 150 page documents. He wasn't sure how many fields, so I'm estimating 10 fields per 150 page document. I had asked during our session today about pricing. @avi shared the AI Hub - Pricing Policy. I first created a spreadsheet to try and build out the estimated cost. Then, I uploaded the policy document to AI Hub and asked it how much it would cost and it gave me the answer, $42/month. According to the partner, this is costing their customers hours and hours of time every month and we could solve it with AI Hub Pro for $42/month (assuming it is 10 fields/doc). This is incredible.

Does that pricing sound correct? If we processed 9000 pages through our platform, with a very aggressive per page cost of $.10/page, that would still cost $900/month (plus the platform fee). The AI Hub processing would cost roughly $0.005/page, 20 times cheaper.

No comments on the pricing - but the example is very cool! @Saurabh we can add this to the drip list of little case studies. Maybe we can get a little more context on the type of docs and company @ChrisM Feel free to send directly to Saurabh
I realize it did price it incorrectly. It used the unit costs from the "BUILD" table, not the "BATCH RUN" table.
And, I can't get it to use the Batch Run table (at least with my prompts).
Actually, could it be rounding? I thought it was pulling from the "BUILD" table, but that should actually be "9 units / field". I think it is rounding.... And, I would think that is a problem.
It does appear to be rounding. The answers keep getting stranger.
It doesn't understand that a 150 page document is longer than 100 pages.
@ChrisM Did you try the “Advanced” model for this prompt?
@Bas I have a couple of use cases I saw during a hackathon last weekend that could use our platform. Who should I report these use cases to to add them to the drip list?
Send these my way! Thank you

Generative models inherently don't do math very well. Gpt 4 is comparatively better. But the math they do is just memorized math and not actual math. We are planning to give tools like calculator, etc to the model in next versions so that the math could be perfect. Till then it's expected that the math might be imperfect (even with gpt-4 alias advanced model)
